Package com.hissain.jscipy.signal

Class Signal

java.lang.Object
com.hissain.jscipy.signal.Signal
public class Signal extends Object
A facade class providing static utility methods for signal processing, similar to scipy.signal. This class delegates to specific implementations within the library.

    • filtfilt

      public static double[] filtfilt(double[] signal, double sampleRate, double cutoff, int order)
      Applies a zero-phase Butterworth low-pass filter (forward and backward).
      Parameters:
      signal - The input signal.
      sampleRate - The sample rate of the signal.
      cutoff - The cutoff frequency.
      order - The filter order.
      Returns:
      The filtered signal.

      sampleRate - The sample rate of the signal.
      cutoff - The cutoff frequency.
      order - The filter order.
      Returns:
      The filtered signal.

      Parameters:
      signal - The input signal.
      sampleRate - The sample rate of the signal.
      cutoff - The cutoff frequency.
      order - The filter order.
      rippleDb - The passband ripple in decibels.
      Returns:
      The filtered signal.

      public static double[] cheby2_filtfilt(double[] signal, double sampleRate, double cutoff, int order, double stopBandDb)
      Applies a zero-phase Chebyshev Type II low-pass filter (forward and backward).
      Parameters:
      signal - The input signal.
      sampleRate - The sample rate of the signal.
      cutoff - The cutoff frequency.
      order - The filter order.
      stopBandDb - The stopband attenuation in decibels.
      Returns:
      The filtered signal.

    • detrend

      public static double[] detrend(double[] signal, DetrendType type)
      Removes a linear or constant trend from the signal.
      Parameters:
      signal - The input signal.
      type - The type of detrending (LINEAR or CONSTANT).
      Returns:
      The detrended signal.

    • find_peaks

      public static int[] find_peaks(double[] x, Double height, Integer distance, Double prominence)
      Finds peaks in a signal with optional parameters.
      Parameters:
      x - The input signal.
      height - Minimum height of peaks (optional, null to ignore).
      distance - Minimum distance between peaks (optional, null to ignore).
      prominence - Minimum prominence of peaks (optional, null to ignore).
      Returns:
      The indices of found peaks.

    • find_peaks

      public static int[] find_peaks(double[] x)
      Finds peaks in a signal with default parameters.
      Parameters:
      x - The input signal.
      Returns:
      The indices of found peaks.

      Computes the analytic signal using the Hilbert transform.
      Parameters:
      signal - The input signal (real-valued).
      Returns:
      The analytic signal as an array of JComplex objects.

      Returns:

      Returns:

      Returns:

    • rfft

      public static JComplex[] rfft(double[] x)
      Computes the forward FFT of a real-valued signal and returns the positive frequency components (RFFT).
      Parameters:
      x - The input signal.
      Returns:
      The positive frequency components of the FFT.

    • irfft

      public static double[] irfft(JComplex[] x, int n)
      Computes the inverse FFT of a real-valued signal (IRFFT).
      Parameters:
      x - The complex-valued input signal (positive frequencies).
      n - The length of the original signal.
      Returns:
      The real-valued inverse FFT of the signal.

    • welch

      public static Welch.WelchResult welch(double[] x, double fs, int nperseg)
      Compute Power Spectral Density using Welch's method. Uses default Hanning window and 50% overlap.
      Parameters:
      x - Input signal.
      fs - Sampling frequency.
      nperseg - Length of each segment.
      Returns:
      WelchResult containing frequency array (f) and PSD array (Pxx).

    • welch

      public static Welch.WelchResult welch(double[] x, double fs, double[] window, int nperseg, int noverlap)
      Compute Power Spectral Density using Welch's method with custom parameters.
      Parameters:
      x - Input signal.
      fs - Sampling frequency.
      window - Window function array (length must match nperseg).
      nperseg - Length of each segment.
      noverlap - Number of points to overlap between segments.
      Returns:
      WelchResult containing frequency array (f) and PSD array (Pxx).

    • medfilt

      public static double[] medfilt(double[] signal, int kernelSize)
      Applies a median filter to the signal.
      Parameters:
      signal - The input signal.
      kernelSize - The size of the kernel (must be odd).
      Returns:
      The filtered signal.

    • convolve

      public static double[] convolve(double[] signal, double[] window, ConvolutionMode mode)
      Convolves two signals using the specified mode.
      Parameters:
      signal - The first signal.
      window - The second signal (window).
      mode - The convolution mode (e.g., ConvolutionMode.SAME).
      Returns:
      The convolved signal.

    • resample

      public static double[] resample(double[] x, int num)
      Resamples x to num samples using Fourier method along the given axis.
      Parameters:
      x - The input signal.
      num - The number of samples in the resampled signal.
      Returns:
      The resampled signal.

    • savgol_filter

      public static double[] savgol_filter(double[] x, int windowLength, int polyOrder, int deriv, double delta)
      Applies a Savitzky-Golay filter to an array.
      Parameters:
      x - The data to be filtered.
      windowLength - The length of the filter window (i.e., the number of coefficients). window_length must be a positive odd integer.
      polyOrder - The order of the polynomial used to fit the samples. polyorder must be less than window_length.
      deriv - The order of the derivative to compute. This must be a non-negative integer. The default is 0, which means to filter the data without differentiating.
      delta - The spacing of the samples to which the data will be applied. This is only used if deriv > 0. Default is 1.0.
      Returns:
      The filtered data.

    • savgol_filter

      public static double[] savgol_filter(double[] x, int windowLength, int polyOrder)
      Applies a Savitzky-Golay filter to an array (smoothing, derivative=0).
      Parameters:
      x - The data to be filtered.
      windowLength - The length of the filter window.
      polyOrder - The order of the polynomial.
      Returns:
      The filtered (smoothed) data.

    • interp1d_linear

      public static double[] interp1d_linear(double[] x, double[] y, double[] newX)
      Performs linear interpolation on the given data points.
      Parameters:
      x - The x-coordinates of the data points.
      y - The y-coordinates of the data points.
      newX - The x-coordinates at which to evaluate the interpolated values.
      Returns:
      The interpolated values.

    • interp1d_cubic

      public static double[] interp1d_cubic(double[] x, double[] y, double[] newX)
      Performs cubic spline interpolation on the given data points.
      Parameters:
      x - The x-coordinates of the data points.
      y - The y-coordinates of the data points.
      newX - The x-coordinates at which to evaluate the interpolated values.
      Returns:
      The interpolated values.
